poem.title: Mills of God
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
The windmill was my toffee apple on a stick The scandalous got drowned with a millstone round their neck; But what drove a watermill, why a click mill clicked, What a pepper mill processed or a paper mill produced I couldn't say, in the mirl of the metaphor, In the militant glory of god Where the men with the millstones explode And the homicide bombers upload some deal We're supposed to approve and applaud as a secular Judaeo-Christian jihad (for gas)
A mill's a thing for grinding grain to powder. What's a war for?
